item.title: Report E-2024090052
item.description:
Report E-2024090052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XBO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, an unknown amount of Transchem Muriatic Acid (UN1789) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door 36. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the packaging and pallet and estimated that three (3) cups of material was released due to heat causing the material to expand. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage. The impacted product and cardboard was placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
